Early Access Review

There is a unique art style about it, some of the visuals and character animations are nice. The idea of using a flute to wake up flowers remind me of Chibi Robo. But that's where the positive points end.

I had a go at this game, and wasn't impressed to be honest. You can see for yourself why in this little preview I did of the game on stream.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KtXyqRPinuE
----------------------
There is little to no gameplay here. The objectives are confusing and not clear. The camera is glitchy and can be a bother. The music gets very repetitive and is not adjustable. There are also a number of bugs and issues with framerate.
But here is the damning part.
This game has all the features of a demo. Once you play the flute to all five flowers and get the gems, the player loses control of the character, and you get a thanks for playing screen, stopping the player from actively playing the game. That is NOT the way to sell a game on Steam Early Access.

Also after some research, this game is available as a demo for FREE on Kongregate and Newgrounds as a Unity Web Player game. (UPDATE: The dev has stated that the demo is an older version of the game.)

There is no mention of these points in the store page, therefore you are decieving your customers through doing this. The customer paid money for this game, therefore the customer should not be stopped from playing the game after a certain point. It's unfair to the consumer, and the developer should probably mention that it is a demo/preview and a work in progress in the description of the game.
Also, an exit button.
Please.

-Great music.

-Seems to have great potential IF devolpment does continue on it.

-The current price does match the game in its current state (.14 cents less the current 86% off full purchase price)

Cons:

-Inexcusable 'alpha' version is very very incomplete and raw (you cannot exit the game without closing it via task manager)

-Extremely poor optimization

-Extremely poor user interface menu and game menu (it actually lacks a real game menu and seems to still be in some sort of raw game engine playmode)

Closing thoughts:

If this is a partnership with review critics to play off the sensationalism of the current user voted free market for greenlite games for more ratings to bring in more revenues for said reviewer and dev alike I kind of get it. Early Access Review

New Kind of Adventure is an open world action-adventure game by BackTo Basics Gaming. It is a fantastic game, and perhaps the greatest videogame there ever will be.

You play as a young girl named Mary. The story takes place after the parents of the girl get into a fight, Mary then hides away in a closet.

Gameplay:

New Kind of Adventure is open world, and has a wide variety of things to do. As Mary, you can lift objects twice your size, and teleport though what appears to be gates of light, and jump extremely high. As Aqarius, you can play a flute, and make flowers open at will.

Presentation:

Made in unity, this game looks beautiful. It runs well regardless of what setting you chose at the start. It's nice to admire for long periods of time.

Story:

This might be the biggest part of New Kind of Adventure, the story is amazing. Mary, after her parents' ordeal, hides in a closet and passes out. She awakes in this land full of adventure and secrets. Though the game is not complete, I believe they will improve on the already fantastic story.

Overall:

New Kind of Adventure is a phenomenal game. The gameplay itself is extremely fun with all the different possibilities you can approach it. controls feel great and are intuitive with keyboard/mouse. It's impossible to go through every cool thing in the game in this review, there's just so much neat stuff to experience.

[Score: 93/100]

The best thing about owning this game is the unlimited possibilities in writing a review for this game! Where do I start?! There's just so much depth to this game, not only is it a great way of getting my wife to leave me after I stayed up for 10 hours playing the flute to a patch of grass, but it's also an awesome way to learn about how not to make a game. It's like stepping into 1994 back when the pinnacle of gaming technology was CD-ROM children's crime mystery games, only that this game still would have felt outdated then. I would rate this game 0/10 but it's something you have to experience, and for the low cost of $0.14 (On sale) or $0.99 full retail, it's well worth it considering how many minutes of your life you will spend in this game as well as the countless sleepless nights after filled with regret and sorrow.

Early Access Review

So I have finally found it. Lets just start by saying I got this game out of a random 5 steam keys from ♥♥♥ wasn't expecting such a master piece.

The first thing I noticed: GRASS it's literally everywhere like WHAT the new crysis doesn't even have this good of looking grass

Then it really hit me. I can play THE FLUTE THE #@%ING FLUTE TO PLANTS. Now I don't know about you but this is just amazing I really was not expecting to be able to play a flute to flowers ever in all my years of gaming.

You can play as a weird little dark guy named Aquarius. Now that name implies that I should be able to go swimming at later levels. I'm really hoping for this dev if you're reading water levels are important.

You can also play as a little girl named mary. She is extremely odd jumps about what I would guess is about 30 feet and can pick up giant ?boulders? and giant strawberries that are larger than her in width and height.

There are also Druids" 3 of them so far that I have found and they'll sell you some stuff for certain amount of other items. Now I can not figure out how to get the other items perhaps they're not in the game yet? I'm not sure but most of them do seem like they wouldn't help much at the current level you can play. The fact you can buy a shield is to me hinting at the fact that there might be combat but I'm not sure.

Another thing is there are what I think are portals all over outside I've only gotten one to work once other than that they're hard to use and don't seem to work and I don't see a need for them you move quite fast.

The graphics are also a very intersting take a very vibrant and blown out look to them something I don't think I have ever seen before. The game for me does not run very well but I am just assuming because it is currently alpha and no its not my pc I can run crysis 2 ultra so I would assume this should be just fine. The animations for jumping are still pretty static little to no body movement just an up and down motion and while falling it seems to jitter quite weirdly a lot.

I could definitely see this game going places in the future and has a lot of potential I cannot wait to see more and will continue to update my review throughout the updates.

tl;dr I like it but it is still too early to be "good"
